required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sustaining Physical Activity Following Cardiac Rehabilitation Completion
clinical_study.official_title: Sustaining Physical Activity Following Cardiac Rehabilitation Completion

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: Cardiac rehabilitation participants will be enrolled during cardiac rehabilitation and provided an activity tracker to use.

detailed_description.textblock: Cardiac rehabilitation participants will be enrolled during cardiac rehabilitation and provided an activity tracker to use. Each week they will be provided a summary report of their steps and physical activity, that will continue to 6 weeks post discharge from cardiac rehabilitation.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a pilot study. All participants receive the intervention.

primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention (during cardiac rehab starting on the day the tracker was given to cardiac rehab discharge), a total of up to 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Average steps per day measured by the activity tracker

primary_outcome.measure: Average Physical Activity in Minutes Per Day (Preintervention Period)
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention (during cardiac rehab starting on the day the tracker was given to cardiac rehab discharge), a total of up to 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Average "very active" minutes per day of physical activity measured by the activity tracker

primary_outcome.time_frame: Intervention (day following cardiac rehab discharge to the day the last weekly report was sent), a total of up to 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Average steps per day measured by the activity tracker

primary_outcome.measure: Average Physical Activity in Minutes Per Day (Intervention Period)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Intervention (day following cardiac rehab discharge to the day the last weekly report was sent), a total of up to 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Average "very active" minutes per day of physical activity measured by the activity tracker

primary_outcome.time_frame: Maintenance (day following when the last weekly report was sent to last day of tracking by staff), a total of up to 15 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Average steps per day measured by the activity tracker

primary_outcome.measure: Average Physical Activity Per Day (Maintenance Period)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Maintenance (day following when the last weekly report was sent to last day of tracking by staff), an overall total of up to 15 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Average "very active" minutes per day of physical activity measured by the activity tracker

arm_group.description: Participants provided an activity tracker to wear and weekly reports

intervention.description: Individually tailored daily and weekly physical activity goals established for all participants. Participants sent weekly reports for 6 weeks after cardiac rehabilitation discharge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- coronary heart disease
- currently attending cardiac rehabilitation with at least 4 weeks left
- >=18 years of age
- own a smart phone and able to participate in mobile health program
- able to understand and write English
- adequate clinical stability
- understand and sign informed consent
Exclusion criteria:
- currently using a digital physical activity tracker
- past use of a digital activity tracker
- planning to relocate in 12 weeks
- acute coronary artery disease symptoms
- decompensated heart failure
- New York Heart Association class IV heart failure
- severe valvular heart disease
- severe pulmonary hypertension
- cardiac transplantation
- visually impaired, severe
- end stage renal disease
- impairment from stroke, injury, or other medical disorder that precludes participation
- dementia that precludes ability to participate and follow protocol
- inability or unwillingness to comply with study requirements

overall_official.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

facility.name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

patient_data.ipd_description: Time Frame: Deidentified individual data that supports the activity tracker results may be shared from 0-12 months following publication. Access Criteria: An investigator who proposes to use the data must have approval from an Institutional Review Board (IRB), Independent Ethics Committee (IEC), or Research Ethics Board (REB), as applicable, and execute a data use/sharing agreement with UNC.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
